ComicInfo.Characters: Clark (death),Hellboy [Anung un Rama] (revelation of true name and supposed destiny),Prof. Dr. Herman von Klempt (apparent death),see Notes),Grigori Rasputin,Abe Sapien,the Baba Yaga,Hecate,Dagda,Sir Edward (introduction,other BPRD personnel [Bureau of Paranormal Research and Defense],Prof. Dr. Karl Ruprect Kroenen (apparent death),Leopold Kurtz (corpse),Roderick Zinco (apparent death),Dr. Kate Corrigan

ComicInfo.Notes: Tagged with comicbox 1.1.1 on 2024-03-13T18:36:19 [Issue ID 4000-42851] urn:comicvine:4000-42851 Tagged with ComicTagger 1.6.0a13.dev122 using info from Grand Comics Database on 2024-06-16 10:42:51. [Issue ID 59341]
ComicInfo.Summary:
Wake the Devil [Chapter Five]: Hellboy's signal is traced to a Romanian church, where Rasputin confronts Abe and speaks of revenge against those who killed him. Giurescu and then Hecate face Hellboy at the crossroads. Hecate tells him about his destiny as Anung un Rama, the Beast of the Apocalypse, a mysterious cloaked figure, and Dagda look on. Kate Corrigan arrives to extract Hellboy and tell him what has befallen the other teams. Rasputin appears at the Norwegian castle headquarters of Project Ragna Rok and strikes Zinco blind, causing him to stumble into a detonator that destroys the castle.
Grave [Part 5]: "Like One, That on a Lonesome Road Doth Walk in Fear and Dread, and Having Once Turned Round Walks On, and Turns No More His Head; Because He Knows, a Frightful Fiend Doth Close Behind Him Tread.": The supernatural conflagration of Benedict and McGrew's melee destroys Adler's house. St. George is disappointed in Sunset's disbelief after all she's seen, but a final encounter with Daphne's spirit compels her to report as much of the story as possible. Benedict tells St. George to brace for more encounters with the forces of darkness.
ComicInfo.Teams: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense,Project Ragna Rok
ComicInfo.Title: Wake the Devil [Chapter Five]; Grave [Part 5]: "Like One, That on a Lonesome Road Doth Walk in Fear and Dread, and Having Once Turned Round Walks On, and Turns No More His Head; Because He Knows, a Frightful Fiend Doth Close Behind Him Tread."
